far_heaa.math_operations package

Submodules

far_heaa.math_operations.polar_calculations module

class far_heaa.math_operations.polar_calculations.PolarMaths

Bases: object

A class to perform mathematical operations involving polar and cartesian coordinates, and to divide a circle into equal angles.

polar_to_cartesian(radius, angle)

Converts polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates.

cartesian_to_polar(x, y)

Converts cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates.

divide_circle_degrees(n)

Divides a circle into n equal angles in degrees.

distance_calculator(n, N)

Calculates the distance between two values n and N.

total_num_bars(n)

Calculates the total number of bars based on a given value of n.

angle_assigner(length)

Assigns angles based on the length of a sequence.

angle_assigner(length: int) → ndarray

Assigns angles based on the length of a sequence. If the length is even, the angles are halved.

Parameters:

length (int) – The length of the sequence to assign angles to.

Returns:

An array of angles in degrees.

Return type:

np.ndarray

static cartesian_to_polar(x: float | ndarray, y: float | ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Converts cartesian coordinates (x, y) to polar coordinates (radius, angle).

Parameters:

  • x (float or np.ndarray) – The x-coordinate in cartesian coordinates or an array of such.

  • y (float or np.ndarray) – The y-coordinate in cartesian coordinates or an array of such.

Returns:

The polar coordinates (radius, angle), where the angle is in radians.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

static distance_calculator(n: float, N: float) → float

Calculates the distance between two values n and N using the formula: 2 * 1 / sqrt(n - N).

Parameters:

  • n (float) – The first value (numerator).

  • N (float) – The second value (denominator).

Returns:

The calculated distance.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ValueError – If n is equal to N, which would result in division by zero.

static divide_circle_degrees(n: int) → ndarray

Divides a circle into n equal angles in degrees.

Parameters:

n (int) – The number of divisions or angles.

Returns:

An array of n equally spaced angles in degrees.

Return type:

np.ndarray

static polar_to_cartesian(radius: float, angle: float) → Tuple[float, float]

Converts polar coordinates (radius, angle) to cartesian coordinates (x, y).

Parameters:

  • radius (float) – The radius in polar coordinates.

  • angle (float) – The angle in radians.

Returns:

The cartesian coordinates (x, y) corresponding to the polar coordinates.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

static total_num_bars(n: int) → int

Calculates the total number of bars using the formula 2^n - 2.

Parameters:

n (int) – The input value used to calculate the total number of bars.

Returns:

The total number of bars.

Return type:

int

far_heaa.math_operations.thermo_calculations module

class far_heaa.math_operations.thermo_calculations.ThermoMaths

Bases: object

A set of functions to calculate thermodynamic properties such as enthalpy, entropy, Gibbs free energy, and vibrational energy.

Based on Zhang et al., “A Fast and Robust Method for Predicting the Phase Stability of Refractory Complex Concentrated Alloys Using Pairwise Mixing Enthalpy”. http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4081906

avg_T_melt(composition: str | List[str], mol_ratio: List[float]) → float

Calculates the average melting temperature for a given alloy composition.

Parameters:

  • composition (Union[str, List[str]]) – The element composition of the alloy.

  • mol_ratio (List[float]) – The mole fractions of the elements.

Returns:

The average melting temperature.

Return type:

float

calc_config_entropy(mol_ratio: Dict[str, float]) → float

Calculates the configurational entropy for a given mole ratio.

Parameters:

mol_ratio (Dict[str, float]) – A dictionary of mole fractions for each element.

Returns:

The configurational entropy in eV/K.

Return type:

float

Raises:

AssertionError – If the mole fractions do not sum to 1.

static calc_gibbs_energy(enthalpy: float, entropy: float, temperature: float) → float

Calculates the Gibbs free energy.

Parameters:

  • enthalpy (float) – The enthalpy value.

  • entropy (float) – The entropy value.

  • temperature (float) – The temperature in Kelvin.

Returns:

The Gibbs free energy.

Return type:

float

calc_mutinary_multilattice_mix_enthalpy(mol_ratio: Dict[str, float], binary_dict: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]], end_member_dict: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]], transition_temperatures: Dict[str, List[float | str]], correction: bool, temperature: float, model: str) → Dict[str, float] | int

Calculates the multinary multilattice mixing enthalpy for an alloy system.

Parameters:

  • mol_ratio (Dict[str, float]) – Mole ratios of the components.

  • binary_dict (Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]) – Dictionary of binary mixing enthalpies.

  • end_member_dict (Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]) – Dictionary of end member energies for each phase.

  • transition_temperatures (Dict[str, List[Union[str, float]]]) – Transition temperatures and phases.

  • correction (bool) – Whether to apply a correction for transition metals.

  • temperature (float) – The temperature in Kelvin.

  • model (str) – The thermodynamic model to use (“regular” or “subregular”).

Returns:

A dictionary of mixing enthalpies for each lattice or 0 if

the number of elements is less than 2.

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, float], int]

static calc_pairwise_interaction_parameter(mix_enthalpy: float, mol_i: float, mol_j: float) → float

Calculates the pairwise interaction parameter (omega_ij) from the binary mixing enthalpy.

Parameters:

  • mix_enthalpy (float) – Binary equimolar mixing enthalpy of elements i and j.

  • mol_i (float) – Mole fraction of element i.

  • mol_j (float) – Mole fraction of element j.

Returns:

Pairwise interaction parameter in eV/atom.

Return type:

float

static calc_regular_model_enthalpy(mol_fraction: List[float], omega: float) → array

Calculates the enthalpy using the regular model.

Parameters:

  • mol_fraction (List[float]) – Mole fractions of the components.

  • omega (float) – The interaction parameter.

Returns:

The calculated enthalpy.

Return type:

np.array

static calc_subregular_model_enthalpy(mol_fraction: List[float], omega1: float, omega2: float) → array

Calculates the enthalpy using the subregular model.

Parameters:

  • mol_fraction (List[float]) – Mole fractions of the components.

  • omega1 (float) – The first interaction parameter.

  • omega2 (float) – The second interaction parameter.

Returns:

The calculated enthalpy.

Return type:

np.array
